items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty near 22,100, Asia falls sharply on Trump's tariff plan
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Wall Street's main stock indexes closed sharply lower on Monday after President Donald Trump announced the start of 25% tariffs on Canada and Mexico, with the S&P 500 posting its biggest daily percentage decline since December 18. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 649.67 points, or 1.48%, to 43,191.24, the S&P 500 lost 104.78 points, or 1.76%, to 5,849.72 and the Nasdaq Composite lost 497.09 points, or 2.64%, to 18,350.19.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: Wall Street's main stock indexes closed sharply lower on Monday after President Donald Trump announced the start of 25% tariffs on Canada and Mexico, with the S&P 500 posting its biggest daily percentage decline since December 18.

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: ASK Automotive, RBL Bank, Godrej Properties, IEX, Uno Minda, Intellect Design in focus on 4 March
items.description: Stocks to Watch, Mar 4: Stocks like CEAT, Xchanging Solutions, UCO Bank, Onix Solar Energy, REC, Newjaisa Technologies, Anlon Technology Solutions, Sunteck Realty, Wendt India, Dr Agarwals Eye Hospital, and Nukleus Office Solutions will be in focus on March 4.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade Larsen & Toubro, Narayana Hrudayalaya, JSW Energy, Bajaj Finance, PFC, and others on March 4?
items.description: The market may attempt a bounce back considering the oversold conditions, but it is unlikely to sustain the same. Below are some trading ideas for the near term.

items.title: IEX shares in focus as traded volumes jump 9% in February
items.description: IEX Share Price: In February, IEX's electricity traded volume increased by 9 percent on-year to 9,622 million units for the month.

items.title: Samvardhana Motherson becomes a Tier-I supplier for Airbus' commercial aircraft after latest contract
items.description: The deal marks a significant expansion of Motherson’s relationship with Airbus, as the company is already a Tier 1 supplier for Airbus Helicopter and Airbus Defence and Space.

items.title: HPCL, BPCL, Indian Oil shares jump up to 6% as oil slumps on Trump’s tariffs and OPEC+ output hike
items.description: The OPEC+ has decided to proceed with a planned oil output increase of 138,000 barrels per day, the first since 2022. The upcoming rise in oil supply significantly weighed on oil prices.

items.title: Taking Stock: Market recovers but ends lower amid trade war concerns; smallcaps outperform
items.description: Bharat Electronics, SBI, BPCL, Shriram Finance, Adani Enterprises were among major gainers on the Nifty, while losers were Bajaj Auto, Hero MotoCorp, Bajaj Finserv, Nestle and Eicher Motors.

items.title: Bajaj Auto shares tank 5%, hit 52-week low as February sales concern investors
items.description: Bajaj Auto share price: Two-wheeler sales saw only a marginal uptick at 2,99,418 units compared to 2,94,684 units in February 2024. The increase was largely driven by a 23 percent surge in exports to 1,53,280 units

items.title: Pharma, IT stocks tumble up to 4% as Trump tariffs take effect
items.description: Tariffs are expected to make investors move away from export-sensitive stocks, including IT and pharma

items.title: Titan shares slip as Macquarie lowers price target, cuts estimates
items.description: Gold prices saw a second straight month of rallying amid growing market uncertainty. High gold prices have a damaging impact on jewellery demand and may hamper Titan's near-term growth trajectory.

items.title: IKS Health: Can this stock restore your portfolio’s health?
items.description: IKS Health is an opportunity to participate in the US healthcare outsourcing market that is growing at a steady pace and is still relatively under-penetrated

items.title: Jupiter Wagons shares rise 5% after mobility arm launches new factory for LCVs
items.description: The company further aspires to achieve a revenue target of Rs 100 crore in the first year of the operations, said Vivek Lohia, the Managing Director of the Group.

items.title: SBI shares jump 3% after Citi's double upgrade to 'buy'
items.description: Citi also raised its price target for SBI to Rs 830, reflecting an upside potential of 20 percent from the previous close.

items.title: Tata Motors, Tata Investment shares rise upto 3% amid buzz over Tata Capital eyeing $11 bn valuation
items.description: Tata Motors holds a nearly 4 percent stake in Tata Capital, while Tata Investment Corporation owns around 2 percent of the equity.

items.title: Primary markets witness best ever start for a year even as secondary markets remain in turmoil
items.description: In the first two months of 2025, nine mainboard firms launched their IPOs, collectively raising Rs 15,723 crore, while 40 SMEs made their debut, securing nearly Rs 1,804 crore.

items.title: Aadhar Housing: Growth story continues with steady asset quality
items.description: The company delivered healthy quarterly earnings and is poised to leverage sectoral tailwinds

items.title: Agri Picks Report March 04, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, The area under summer crops in Gujarat stood at 271,470 hectares as of Monday, down 6.4% from 289,981 hectares a year ago, according to a report released by the state agriculture department.

items.title: Short Call | March may not be any different from February for small-midcaps; UltraTech Cement, Coal India in focus
items.description: 'A market downturn doesn’t bother us. It is an opportunity to increase our ownership of great companies with great management at good prices.' -- Warren Buffett
